title: How to build a website with out knwing anything about coding - Quora

response.answer_text: There are two ways to do it: Using a CMS (Content Management System)Using Site BuildersThe choice depends on what kind of website you are building. CMS is an application that runs on any server and allows you to create, store, search and manage content that are usually stored in databases. These applications provide an admin panel from where we can manage our contents. CMS provides reasonable abstraction to the working of the entire system so that anyone (developers and non-developers) can make use of all the functionalities of the CMS. You might need to get familiar with their admin panel to make full use of it. CMS is used if the site you are building contains a lot of dynamic content. Some well known CMS are: WordPress.com: Create a Free Website or BlogJoomla Content Management System (CMS)Drupal - Open Source CMSWebsite Builders make it easy to build a website on the website builder's hosting platform (Unlike CMS you don't have to worry about hosting). They are easy to use as long as you have a slight idea about how a website should look and what are the different UI elements. They usually provides a drag and drop kind of workflow which allows you to design a website much faster than with CMS. These site builders do not provide high flexibility since they are used to build a particular type of website and the functionalities to be added are limited to those in the builder's hosting platform. They are used mostly for building static sites but some of them offer content management limited to some type of websites. Some of the well known Site Builders are:Wix.comWeeblyShopify

If you want to make a website by yourself and avoid coding, then I can present TWO options: • Use online builders, price is ~ $130/year • Use CMS (content management system), price is ~ $50/year I want to emphasize that in 2017 creating a website is a piece of cake and beginners can definitely do that. So, which one do pick (builders or CMS)? You don’t need coding with either of them but Google views them both as a code because Google bots are robots and they only see the code. In case of builders – the code is not so search engine friendly… it means that builder’s code is not so crawlable as is with CMS and thus – you have more work to do in order to get top positions on search engine results page. So, I recommend using CMS. Building with them both is similar: just drag-and-drop elements, like putting bricks together while playing with Lego’s. If you want to know more about builders, then here’s an in-depth review: 10 Best Website Builders Reviewed. (I bought and signed up.) And if you want to create a top-notch website with CMS (For example - WordPress), then here’s a tutorial: How to Create a Website | An Easy 3-Step Guide for Beginners 2017  Definitely create a website and new opportunities arise. Don.
